intro: Centaurea panormitana subsp. ucriae, commonly known as the Sicilian star-thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Sicily. It is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and vibrant blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other Centaurea species.
